page.title: 13Bilston Market worker
page.content: Simon Pel has lived in Bilston all his life; he works in the market each Saturday on a Bedding stall. The market opens at 6 - 30 a.m. and it takes at least 90 minutes to set up a stall. He wks all day Saturday for the small amount of 15 pounds. The man he works for is Jagaish Singh and the owner of the stall is John Tesra who also owns stalls and warehouses in Bristol and Birmingham. Simon has worked on these stalls for two years. They travel to other markets at Polsworth,Bristol and Birmingham. All market traders have to abide by certain rules. (a) All trolleys out by 7-00 a.m. (b) The trolleys must be put back in the shed. (c) Trolleys are to be out again at 4-00p.m. (d) Take trolleys back to Car Park (gates of car-park open at 3-30p.m)
